Row.Text: "Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?"[NEWLINE]-T. S. Eliot
"A person who deserves my loyalty receives it."[NEWLINE]-Joyce Maynard
"Jeder König kommt aus einer Rasse von Sklaven empor, und jeder Sklave hatte Könige unter seinen Vorfahren"[NEWLINE]-Plato
"We all have idols. Play like anyone you care about but try to be yourself while you're doing so."[NEWLINE]-B.B. King
"Ich würde lieber sterben bevor ich etwas tue, von dem ich weiß, dass es eine Sünde ist oder gegen Gottes Willen."[NEWLINE]-Jeanne d'Arc
"Der Glaube ist ein Vorausverkosten jener Erkenntnis, die uns in der Zukunft glückselig macht."[NEWLINE]-Heiliger Thomas von Aquin

"Follow the path of the unsafe, independent thinker. Expose your ideas to the danger of controversy. Speak your mind and fear less the label of "crackpot" than the stigma of conformity."[NEWLINE]-Thomas J. Watson
"There are three forms of visual art: Painting is art to look at, sculpture is art you can walk around, and architecture is art you can walk through."[NEWLINE]-Dan Rice
"Each of us is carving a stone, erecting a column, or cutting a piece of stained glass in the construction of something much bigger than ourselves."[NEWLINE]-Adrienne Clarkson

"Ich würde nicht sagen, dass die Philosophie und die Vernunft uns Menschen in vorhersehbarer Zeit führen; jedoch bleiben sie der schönste Ort, zu dem einige Auserwählte stoßen konnten und können werden."[NEWLINE]-Albert Einstein
"Technology is a gift of God. After the gift of life it is perhaps the greatest of God's gifts. It is the mother of civilizations, of arts and of sciences."[NEWLINE]-Freeman Dyson
"By virtue of exchange, one man's prosperity is beneficial to all others."[NEWLINE]-Frederic Bastiat
"Language is the armory of the human mind, and at once contains the trophies of its past and the weapons of its future conquests."[NEWLINE]-Samuel T. Coleridge
"Thought takes man out of servitude, into freedom."[NEWLINE]-Henry W. Longfellow
"First they ignore you, then they laugh at you, then they fight you, then you win."[NEWLINE]-Mahatma Gandhi
"We do no benevolences whose first benefit is not for ourselves."[NEWLINE]-Mark Twain

"Our defense is in the preservation of the spirit which prizes liberty as a heritage of all men, in all lands, everywhere. Destroy this spirit and you have planted the seeds of despotism around your own doors."[NEWLINE]-Abraham Lincoln
"A Jedi uses the Force for knowledge and defense, never for attack."[NEWLINE]-A Puppet
"A dream is the bearer of a new possibility, the enlarged horizon, the great hope."[NEWLINE]-Howard Thurman
"An insatiable appetite for glory leads to sacrifice and death, but innate instinct leads to self-preservation and life."[NEWLINE]-Jose Marti
"Gold, on the contrary, though of little use compared with air or water, will exchange for a great quantity of other goods."[NEWLINE]-David Ricardo
"We cannot take one step in geology without drawing upon the fathomless stores of by-gone time."[NEWLINE]-Adam Sedgwick
"Nothing contributes to the entertainment of the reader more, than the change of times and the vicissitudes of fortune."[NEWLINE]-Cicero
